thread.title: Girls soccer: Verona Hillbillies earn 2-1 victory over Newark Academy
thread.title_full: Girls soccer: Verona Hillbillies earn 2-1 victory over Newark Academy

title: Girls soccer: Verona Hillbillies earn 2-1 victory over Newark Academy
text:
Buy this photo Zach Gewelb/Staff Photographer Freshman Lara Tole had a goal and an assist in Verona's 2-1 win over Newark Academy Tuesday, Oct. 13. 
The Verona girls soccer team earned a hard-fought 2-1 victory over Newark Academy Tuesday, Oct. 13 at Centennial Field. The Lady Hillbillies used a late second half goal from freshman Lara Tole to take a lead and held on down the stretch to secure the win. 
Verona played to a 1-1 tie heading into the half. Amanda Maguire recorded the Lady Hillbillies' first goal of the afternoon with help from Tole. The freshman found Maguire near the goal before the senior found the back of the net for the score. 
Tole scored the game winning goal in the second half when she took the ball through Newark Academy's defense and beat the goalie. Verona used stellar defense and strong keeper play to secure the victory. The Lady Hillbillies' played two players between the pipes in Diana Flores and Anna Rosinski. Flores tallied four saves, while Rosinski recorded three. 
The win boosts Verona's record to 5-6-1 on the season.
